results.title: Lack of metformin effect on mouse embryo AMPK activity: implications for metformin treatment during pregnancy.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: Although @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ can have effects associated with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Fetal_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005315 @@@embryopathy@@@ in vitro, the lack of effects on @SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@ embryos in vivo may be due to lack of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ transporters and indicates that the benefits of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ on glycaemic control are not counteracted by stimulation of embryo AMPK activity and consequent @<m>DISEASE_Fetal_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005315 @@@embryopathy@@@.

citations.NLM: Lee HY, Wei D, Loeken MR. Lack of metformin effect on mouse embryo AMPK activity: implications for metformin treatment during pregnancy. Diabetes Metab Res Rev. 2014 Jan;30(1):23-30. PMID: 23983188
citations.BibTeX: @article{23983188, title={Lack of metformin effect on mouse embryo AMPK activity: implications for metformin treatment during pregnancy.}, author={Lee HY and Wei D and Loeken MR}, journal={Diabetes Metab Res Rev}, volume={30}, number={1}, pages={23-30}}

results.title: Maternal metformin treatment decreases fetal inflammation in a rat model of obesity and metabolic syndrome.
results.text_hl: Using in vivo and in vitro models, we examined the effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Fetal_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005315 @@@maternal and fetal inflammation@@@.

citations.NLM: Desai N, Roman A, Rochelson B, Gupta M, Xue X, Chatterjee PK, Tam Tam H, Metz CN. Maternal metformin treatment decreases fetal inflammation in a rat model of obesity and metabolic syndrome. Am J Obstet Gynecol. 2013 Aug;209(2):136.e1-9. PMID: 23659985

results.title: Metformin should be considered in the treatment of gestational diabetes: a prospective randomised study.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ seems to be suitable for the prevention of @<m>DISEASE_Fetal_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005315 @@@fetal macrosomy@@@, especially in lean or moderately overweight @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ developing @DISEASE_Diabetes_Gestational @DISEASE_MESH:D016640 @@@GDM@@@ in late gestation.

citations.NLM: Ijäs H, Vääräsmäki M, Morin-Papunen L, Keravuo R, Ebeling T, Saarela T, Raudaskoski T. Metformin should be considered in the treatment of gestational diabetes: a prospective randomised study. BJOG. 2011 Jun;118(7):880-5. PMID: 21083860
